Reviews.Title: Must login to WiFi every time, No Amazon VOD...otherwise, it's great
Reviews.Author: Marty McCall
Reviews.Content: Right off, here are my two big beefs with this TV.First of all, the TV absolutely, positively will not remember network settings.  Every time the TV goes off, it forgets my wireless network ID and password, and I get to start from scratch the next time I turn it back on.  I've never seen that in a wireless device before.  It's to the point where I get a little angry whenever I use the TV -- generally speaking, not a good sign for a product.It's especially aggravating, since Smart TV features demand you login to the network, even if you're not going to use anything that requires a network collection (like watching a video through a USB hard drive).  Skip the login, and it kicks you right out of the Smart TV app entirely, and you have to restart it.Looked online for a solution, with no joy.  Found several people with the same problem, no solution.  The Samsung site suggested contacting customer support.So contact Samsung support I did...and they were atrocious.  Spent 30 minutes going through an assortment of power cycles and system resets that accomplished nothing.  Then they proclaimed that there was "definitely something wrong," and that I should call the following number...and then gave me the number I'd just called!  I told them that was the number I was speaking to now, and they insisted it wasn't, and that I needed to call that number.So I called it again, and got another rep, who tried to run me through the exact same process; I told rep #2 that I'd just done all those things, and they said they could see that (I was already in their database, having called a few minutes earlier), but this was all he could do.  And that's where I gave it up as a bad job.Seriously.  Awful.  Service.The other beef I have isn't really Samsung's fault, but it does diminish the value of the product: no support for Amazon VOD or Amazon Prime VOD.  No ETA for it either, as far as I can tell.  There's other apps missing too -- NBA, NFL, but the Amazon one hurts the most.Those gripes aside, the TV's great.  Awesome picture.  The Motion Plus stuff is aggravating, but easily disabled.  Sound's a little on the low side, but loud enough most of the time; we've had to plug in an amp on occasion, just to hear certain quieter movies.  Teeny tiny bezel, which makes fitting it into our TV alcove possible; no other 46" inch would have been able to replace our old TV, a 46" Samsung DLP.I'm not sure if everyone's experiencing the network problem too; I'm guessing not.  But if you end up being one of them, my condolences.  I figure at this point I'm stuck with it, and may need to buy a wireless access point, just to eliminate the occasional impulse to put my foot through the screen to avoid needing to punch in my WEP key one...more...time.

Reviews.Title: A solution to your WiFi problems
Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: This TV Samsung Model: UN46D7900 and also the 55 inch!To permanently maintain it's WiFi connection with the in House WiFi Router, you first have to get the MAC Address from the TV.Once you have that,now go log into the House Wifi Router usually 192.168.1.1 and also TYPE ADMIN for Name ID and PASSWORD for PW.Unless you have properly secured your own WiFi Router then you would use your secret ID and Password.Now you need to find Devices in the Router and simply enter the TVs MAC Address there to allow it access.After that is done,every time you turn the TV off and back on,you'll have access because the Router has already stored the TVs Address.I set this up for my Sisters Husband and he has not had a single issue with it.Same scenario with iPods,iPhones,or anything else wireless in the House.Hope this helps those frustrated with this issue.

Reviews.Title: Simply Amazing!
Reviews.Author: The Rick
Reviews.Content: Well after having the TV to play with all day today I would have to say that I am thorough impressed. I decided to go with the 7900 vs. the 8000 because it was slightly less but all the specs on the TVs matched up. I have had a chance to configure it and now watch a variety of movies and TV. I'll be watching some 3d stuff in the near future and can update that later.When asking my wife who doesn't really care about things what she thought she said she was amazed she felt as if she was sitting on set watching her favorite shows. Anyone that is looking for an amazing TV at an amazing price from Amazon look no further. The setup was a breeze and didn't have any problems getting the internet up and running. Once I turned it on I was watching tv 5 minutes later.

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV.  Un55d7900
Reviews.Author: chipper 1109
Reviews.Content: By far the best TV we have ever owned.  3-D viewing is awesome, apps are a little slow but know big deal to us since we don't use the TV for the internet.  However, when we do use the TV to view certain apps it works just fine.  Not much different than the 8000 series except for the bezel and the 8000 comes with 3-d glasses.  For the picture quality and the price at Amazon you cant beat it.  The people on TV appear so real you feel there in the room with you.  Some reviews mention the white bleeding in around the corners which is only visible sometimes when not viewing the entire screen.  My wife and I hardly notice it.  Highly recommend this TV.  Thanks Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Samsung
Reviews.Author: Defective Product
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product less than 30 days ago. Initially everything seem to be working properly.  However, after about two weeks the Qwerty side of the remote control would no longer pair with the TV.  Additionally, once I purchased compatible 3D glasses, the 3D glasses could not be paired with the TV.  After checking all of the manuals and the TV operations I contacted Samsung.  It was determined that the blue tooth functionality of the TV was not working.  I also attempted to search for the blue tooth on my phone and nothing for the Samsung could be located.So the customer service representative said they would have a technician come out to service the TV.  This is already an issue for me, since it is a brand new TV that is now defective.  The first technician company that contacted me, refused to come out because they were more than 60 miles away.  Why would Samsung refer them my service request?  So I had to contact Samsung again to have a new service ticket opened.Another technician came out and after about 10 minutes messing around with the remote said he could not do anything and would have to take the TV back to the shop for 5 days as it is possible a new board would need to be ordered?  Another unsatisfying experience.  So I thought they would have known that was the problem after I went through this with the Samsung customer service representative.  Why wouldn't they have already ordered a replacement part.  So I didn't let them take the TV.  I wanted them to order the part (again they don't know exactly what was wrong, because the technician didn't do any trouble shooting beyond playing around with the remote control), and let me know once the part arrived.  And now I would have to bring the TV to the shop as they will not make a repeat trip.  Totally dissatisfied.  Now my problem is I no longer have the original box, and want Amazon to replace the TV.My advice, never by a high priced item online.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME LED TV UN55D7900
Reviews.Author: Phong "Dragon"
Reviews.Content: I have made an extensive research on LED TV for months before deciding to buy the Samsung UN55D7900, which is almost identical to the UN55D8000. The only difference is no 3D glasses included, but the price is a stealing. I paid only $1,666.49 including tax, shipping and white glove delivery. I am very happy with the service of the courier. He carried the box into the house, opened it and tested the LED TV before asking me to sign the releasing paper. The picture is crystal clear. You can't ask for anything better than this! The design is elegant which makes your living room more enjoyable. There are tons of options for setting up. I am still exploring and very satisfied with this purchase from Amazon that saved me a lot of money and time. If anyone is still looking for the LED TV, I definitely recommend this one. You can't go wrong with this!! Trust me!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Picture ... After Calibration
Reviews.Author: Hsin Pai "Consumer Extraordinaire"
Reviews.Content: I replaced a three year old Samsung LN46A750 which has a terrific picture with a Samsung UN55D7900.  I chose the UN55D7900 over the UN55D8000 because it has a slightly thicker frame, which appears to eliminate some of the reported backlighting issues because of the thinner frame.  After setting up the new UN55D7900 I was very disappointed with the initial picture quality ... too blurry in spots and overly sharp/grainy in others.  I thought I had made a mistake in upgrading to this set, only to find the picture substantially inferior to my old tv and considered returning it.  I researched the internet and found very little information on calibrating the UN55D7900.  However, I did find several sites for calibrating the UN55D8000 which is basically the same tv except for panel thickness.  Following the most popular settings from CNET and making a few of my own adjustments, I'm very pleased with this tv.  The bluriness and graininess are gone.  Picture is smoother and more uniformally sharp and has excellent color and warmth.  At first I found the picture mode: movie, too dim, but after making all of the adjustments, found it to be just about perfect and easier on the eyes, especially in low lighting.  I had an initial tendency to over brighten/over contrast the picture to pull out detail, but the picture rendered is too harsh.  Following are the final adjustments that worked for me.  It's worth playing around a little to get a better feeling for what you like.  If you don't like it, you can always hit the 'reset to factory standard' at the end of the list.Below you'll find the settings that optimize the Samsung UN55D7900 in a dim room via HDMI input at 1080p/60 resolution. Your settings may vary depending on source, room conditions, and personal preference. Good luck and post your feedback here to share your results so we can learn what you works best.--Picture menuMode: MovieBacklight: 10Contrast: 96Brightness: 51Sharpness: 25Color: 47Tint: G50/R50Screen adjustment submenu:Picture Size: Screen FitPosition: [no change]Auto Adjustment submenu: [Grayed out]Advanced settings submenu:Black tone: OffDynamic contrast: OffGamma: -1Expert Pattern: OffRGB Only Mode: OffColor space: CustomWhite Balance: [see below]10p White Balance: OnFlesh tone: 0Edge enhancement: OnMotion Lighting: OffxvYCC: OffLED Motion Plus: CinemaColor Space submenu:Red: Red 59, Green 0, Blue 0Green: Red 10, Green 55, Blue 10Blue: Red 0, Green 6, Blue 61Yellow: Red 53, Green 50, Blue 0Cyan: Red 4, Green 49, Blue 50Magenta: Red 37, Green 4, Blue 41White balance submenu:R-Offset: 19G-Offset: 18B-Offset: 20R-Gain: 31G-Gain: 29B-Gain: 2410p White Balance submenu:Interval 1: Red 2, Green 2, Blue 2Interval 2: Red -1, Green -1, Blue -1Interval 3: Red 1, Green 1, Blue 0Interval 4: Red 3, Green 3, Blue 2Interval 5: Red 6, Green 4, Blue 3Interval 6: Red 7, Green 6, Blue 4Interval 7: Red 5, Green 6, Blue 4Interval 8: Red 3, Green 3, Blue 2Interval 9: Red 1, Green 1, Blue 0Interval 10: Red -2, Green 0, Blue -1Picture options submenuColor tone: Warm2Digital Noise Filter: OffMPEG Noise Filter: OffHDMI black level: Normal [grayed out]Film mode: Off [grayed out]Auto motion plus: Custom-- Custom settings:Blur reduction: 10Judder reduction: 4Smart LED: StandardCinema Black: On

Reviews.Title: one word : great
Reviews.Author: spartan
Reviews.Content: great service. great product. great price.The only concern that i had was the speakers. I even bought the polk-audio 3000 speaker bar before the tv had gotten my home. It turns out the speakers work just fine for me.Just one suggestion, if you just wanna watch Netflix without enjoyong Blu-ray movies. There are many good Tvs with good price out there for you to choose. Netflix looks great with this 7900 series. However, i am not able to see the difference between my LG lx6500 and this 7900 ( maybe it is just me). I just got this TV 3 days ago. It has been great and i hope it stays this way.to sum it up, it is a great TV and i really think my money is well spent.I am still waiting for my 3d-starter to come. Once i get my starter, i will update my 3D experience with this TV.Hopefully my review helps someone who was like me looking for a good TV.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Hogster
Reviews.Content: I've had the UN55D7900 now for two weeks and Love It! It exceeds my expectations..... I'm told that it's the same TV as the UND8000 but with the clear bezel instead of the silver.  I couldn't believe it when I connected to the internet and it had near 5,000 movie titles to choose from for download, unfortunately my internet service (Verizon) only limits me to 5gb per month usage.  Nice Job Samsung!!

Reviews.Title: Nice picture but...
Reviews.Author: Kevin L.
Reviews.Content: I ordered this tv to replace a Samsung plasma 42" that I have had for about 6 years for no other reason than to get a bigger screen. The plasma has such a great picture and has been problem free, so why not go with one of Samsung's newer LED tv's, right?! Out of the box this is a beautiful tv. Nice design, super lightweight, and ultra-thin. Has tons of internet functions and has a very crisp and clean picture. However, mine happened to have a dark area in the top left side of the screen that was about 14" wide and 4" from the top down that can best be desribed as a shadow. It was there no matter what the source (cable box, DVD, game console, etc) and the picture was noticeably darker in that area. Obviously some sort of defect that made keeping it out of the question. Sent it back to Amazon for a refund. Gave it 2 stars overall for poor quality but good potential.

Reviews.Title: Amazing 3d Tv!!!
Reviews.Author: VwrudeboyGli
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv at a great price and it came with 6 pairs of 3d glasses and a samsung 3d wifi bluray player about 2 weeks ago. I was actually looking for a 42-46 inch tv for my bedroom, but the price on this set and for what I got it for at an open box deal was such a great deal to miss on, especially I been drouling over the same series for awhile now.lol  So i put my 50 inch plasma in my bedroom now and the new Samsung 55 inch in my living room. lolAfter playing with this tv for about 2 weeks, I must say this Samsung tv is beautiful!! Full crisp picture, watching 3d movies are insane cant believe how crystal clear the movies are in 3d and I think its a lot better then watching a 3d movie at the theatres. I have also played my Ps3 and Xbox on it. I played CoD Black ops in 3d and WOW!! lolI also have Directv hooked up to it and a Pioneer 3d audio receiver. I upgraded my 5 year old HDMI wires with HDMI 3d speed cables and I mut say there is a difference if you use your old HDMI on a 3d set. I used my old HDMI's on day hooking them up and I noticed how sluggish and grainy things were, so I ordered the new cables thru online and when they came in I hooked them up and eveything was great the 240hz came alive and picture quality was great!! I am very Happy with this unit and if anyone has been looking to buy a great 3d tv the Samsung 55d 7900 series is great!!

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: dalia
Reviews.Content: Very nice and wide screen TV. Ultra slim and light weight compared to its size. Has so many features plus its wi fi is great.

Reviews.Title: STAY AWAY FROM SAMSUNG
Reviews.Author: Just Sayin'
Reviews.Content: *****W A R N I N G*****Do not buy SAMSUNG Televisions!!!  After the one year warranty period SAMSUNG Television screens tend to show burn-in and ghosting with horizontal lines, along with very heavy distortion of picture on right side of screen.  This problem is systemic in all their LCD's and LED's.  Consumer's have complained all over the internet.  There are even numerous Youtube postings with the exact same problems as in my DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG model, as well as the same DEFECT in other models.  This defect occurs upon start-up, and lasts for the first 15 minutes of trying to view a program. Then the picture gets progressively worse over time and continuously declines.I tried SAMSUNG's Executive Customer Relations Dept. and was told:  "We will do nothing but refer you to a local Authorized Repair Shop."  They were downright blunt and rude to boot!  I feel robbed of $2,900.00The repair will consist of a diagnosis visit, and then another visit to install a replacement "Panel" that costs $1,300.00 for the part plus $279.00 to install, plus taxes......all told, another $1,719.16....basically, buy another TV.SAMSUNG customer service also told me that their Televisions depreciate at 20% per year, and they do not repair any of their products after 4 years!  Their own repair people told me to just buy a new set!!!If I save one family the heartache of losing they're hard-earned money, I'll be happy!SAMSUNG CONS:No Customer SupportSystemic Panel DefectGhosting of imagesBurn-in on screenDistorted pictureVery expensive to repair

Reviews.Title: Quit working after 13 months
Reviews.Author: Nancy Berry
Reviews.Content: Extremely disappointed in this TV.  The picture started to fade in and out after 8 months of use.  I trouble shooted what I thought might be some issues with compatability  with the cable box but this turned out to not be the issue.  Over time the frequency of the picture going out increased and now there is no picutre a lot.  very unhappy with quality and customer service.

Reviews.Title: Model and price
Reviews.Author: dubclub
Reviews.Content: Model: Great TV, one step down from the ultimate top-of-the-line > UN(size)D 8000.  I bought the 8000 for the 900 motion pass rate (7xxx series all have a 720 pass rate) and design - which IMO is a little sleeker.Price:  Shop around... the 8000 60 inch can be found new from an auth retailer for about the same price! Either way, you can't go wrong with this line from Samsung.  Features, reliability, usability and aesthetics are all class leader.  You spend a little more for Samsungs top models but they are definitely worth the price in the long run.

Reviews.Title: samsung un46d7900 what a great 3d tv
Reviews.Author: charles
Reviews.Content: This is a great tv, I used to have a D6420 for about 8 months and sold it, then I bought this awesome 3d tv, the picture feels like your in the movie or tv show, it has the auto motion plus 240 Hz and I love it even though I know almost no body likes it, the 3D looks so great even when you are converting 2D to 3D, The speakers I think they are ok, at least they are louder then the ones on the D6420 I had before.I've had this tv for almost a week and I've faced a problem with pairing the qwerty remote and 3d glasses, but I already fixed it, the solution is to unplugged the tv for about 1 minute to reset the tv's Bluetooth module, after you plugged in the tv you should be pairing the qwerty remote and 3d glasses with no problem at all.Very happy with this buy and the only difference between the d7900 and d8000 its the metal stand, metal bezel and Samsung logo can be turn on or off on the d8000, I don't think its worth the extra 300 or 400 dollars just for those features when both tvs perform equally.

Reviews.Title: UN55D7900 3D Television
Reviews.Author: Wayne D. Martins
Reviews.Content: I had done quite a bit of research before I picked this product.  A perfect storm of price breaks between my credit card, timing and Amazon converged to get me a very low price including free shipping and no sales tax.  The picture is gorgeous, quite a step up from my old plasma.  The set has met my expectations and then some. For example, simulated 3D from a 2D pictures and movies are quite a novelty.  Streaming 3D works well although more content is awaited. (Requires a high speed internet connection) Browsing the internet works OK albeit it is cumbersome.  A wireless keyboard and mouse would be appreciated.  I have not perused all of the apps that are available but, I will continue.

Reviews.Title: Enjoyable!
Reviews.Author: C David Tabor
Reviews.Content: Was ready to upgrade and thought it would be good to get a really nice product. The Samsung had good reviews elsewhere and I had previous good experience with the brand. Wow! Technology for the picture has really improved over the past 5 years. The image is so clear and the motion is so fluid. I love it, and with the internet and apps built in it is just even more than I expected.

Reviews.Title: So far all is perfect
Reviews.Author: Andrey
Reviews.Content: So far everything is perfect. The quality of picture is amazing. Minimalism of its design is gorgeous. Usability of the menu and remote control is greatly improved since 6th series. Reads my NTFS USB and plays movies like a charm.

Reviews.Title: Beware of Samsung
Reviews.Author: Blacklinesarmy
Reviews.Content: Just a word of caution about buying Samsung products: the company does not stand behind its products. I purchased a Samsung TV and started experiencing problems 3 months after warranty expired. Lines began to appear across my screen. They continue to multiply. Called Samsung they hid behind warranty and said it was a very rare problem. Researched it on the internet and found thousands of posts about the problem. This is a product fail and the company will not accept responsibility for their use of inferior components. When you research Samsung do not google Samsung product and reviews but Samsung product and complaints. You will find huge body of discussion online about Samsung's TV division.

Reviews.Title: Great product and highly recommended
Reviews.Author: Sandeep Saksena "gadget freak"
Reviews.Content: This is an incredible TV. I have 4 large flat panel screens and this is equal to the others. Picture is clear, motion is excellently portrayed. It also works without a hitch in connecting to my wifi router (Belkin 762) and allowing the use of the internet browser is amazing with the built in qwerty keyboard on the back of the remote. It even has a touchpad (similar to that on the blackberry) on the keyboard so you dont need a mouse.

Reviews.Title: Series 7 and 8 Samsungs are the only way to go.
Reviews.Author: Albert R Fitzgerald
Reviews.Content: I have about 7 Samsung TVs and the Series 7 has a far superior picture to the Series 6 or lower.I am not too impressed with all the bells and whistles that come on the Smart TV but I am able toturn off the features I do not want.  Recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Exceptional picture on contrasty images
Reviews.Author: Christian Perversi "argentleman"
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv in february from Amazon and was very pleasantly surprised that it came to my house in perfect conditions and in the time I was told.The TV is absolutely gorgeous and the picture is fantastic when you are watching very contrasty images (such as modern cartoons) or animated films. As you watch tv in absolute darkness (at night) you will notice slight "lighting" of the areas of the screen that are supposed to be completely black (I don't know if micro-dimming was supposed to help this). Not intrusive or distorting, but was expecting better blacks from a $1600 tv.The image flow on this screen is absolutely phenomenal and my wife and I have noticed a sense of depth of image (viewing 2D movies) that we had never experienced on any other set.All the apps work fine, but as many other reviews have pointed out, there is no app for Amazon prime on demand video. This was dissapointing but I just plugged my Roku into one of the HDMI ports and that took care of it. Again, not a deal breaker, but Samsung should get a bit smarter about these things. Hopefully it will come in a software update (I called and requested it).I have also experienced trouble with the qwerty keyboard using Apps such as Youtube. I waited to buy this tv for the keyboard remote, so I was a unhappy to see that some apps don't recognize it and you have to use the 4-way rocker to select the letters and write that way (very time consuming; not to mention annoying as you actually have a keyboard that SHOULD work).Overall I gave it 4 stars because TVs are mostly for seeing TV, movies, etc and that it does well.If I were inclined to use all the internet functionality more than I do and cared less about image quality, I would probably lower the rating to 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: Exactly as advertised
Reviews.Author: Bigboats
Reviews.Content: Got this TV two weeks back after watching the price for well over 3 months. Was easy to set up to what I needed it for and the picture is Ridiculous. Watched the Masters last week and was blown away how crystal clear everything was.So far very good with no complaints. Price point was over $2200.00 But was lucky enough to jump in at 1700.00. Just love this product

Reviews.Title: Exceptional LED TV
Reviews.Author: Otto Bert
Reviews.Content: This LED TV is an exceptional HDTV and an impressive piece of technology. The picture is superb, the software and functionality are expansive, and the thin-ness of the device is remarkable. Amazon's delivery via CEVA was almost as advertised - about 45 minutes later than the time window promised. Set-up was easy, with one glitch: I still can't get the QWERTY side of the remote to "pair" with the TV. The "old style" side of the remote works fine and the fact there's a QWERTY side to the remote is impressive by itself. [update: there is a fix on the Samsung website.  Both the QWERTY remote and the TV itself each have to be reset separately, before pairing.] One error in the manufacturer's on-line information is wall mounting the TV (which I did) requires a VESA 400 x 400 mount; not a 400 x 600 mount. [udpate: The mounting bolts loosened.  Locktite should fix that.] But those are minor flaws in what is overall a very satisfying product and delivery.

Reviews.Title: Best picture of any tv outthere
Reviews.Author: J. Feraco
Reviews.Content: Got my smart tv in June came with free 3d br player free portable br player an 5 movies an 2 pair of 3d glasses.great price 2450.00 this tv has the brightest picture I have ever seen,movies don't look like movies we used to remember.the picture is flawless.hd is incredible.3d is better then other 3d tvs because of thebrighter picture,don't hesitate buy this tv.Only difference between this an the 8000 series is bezel is silver on the 8000 an stand is different it's flat plus samsung logo life's up, not worth extra money picture is all that matters

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: GUY
Reviews.Content: Great TV, Beautiful picture, one of the best looking pictures on a TV that i've ever seen. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Missing 3D Glasses!
Reviews.Author: Anna Shaw
Reviews.Content: "Two pairs of active rechargeable 3D glasses are included to get you started. Samsung's active glasses are lightweight and comfortable, and will fit right over your prescription glasses."Um no there are not 2 pairs of glasses in the box.Otherwise a beautiful TV. But do yourself a favor and buy the 8000 which can be found for the same price on Amazon and comes with the glasses, which are quite expensive.My only complaint is the LED's constantly change the brightness by guessing the relative amount of darkness in the scene. They never seem to be consistent so when the camera cuts between the same scene, it may be dark one time, and horribly bright the next. I need to find a way to stop that!OK, my second complaint. The "Smart TV" UI is a horrible abomination of UI/UX design. It's just a bad ripoff of Apple iPad icons and Apple TV. But it's not done nearly as well and is quite slow. Won't someone just put Boxee on one of these things?

Reviews.Title: 55" samsung tv
Reviews.Author: jane r
Reviews.Content: i've had tv for awhile and i love it. great picture and great looking. i knew this was the tv i wanted and have not been disappointed. i wall mounted it but with the cable box the wires hang down, very ugly. bought a cheap tv console and hid the wires in the wall. kinda a pia. i don't know if i would wall mount it again.

Reviews.Title: Not sure if it was the used model or the TV itself
Reviews.Author: Edwin R. Payne "Edwin Payne"
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time researching LED TVs and thought I had found the right one with this Samsung. I've owned samsungs before and had no problems with them. Once i got this out of the box, there was HUGE glares from the lights in the room. Too the point where it disturbed the picture. My old samsung didn't have that problem, but can't really have a TV that I can only watch in pitch black. The TV itself looks really nice, but the glare was too much . Samsung UN55D7900 55-Inch 1080p 240HZ 3D LED HDTV (Silver)

Reviews.Title: Broke after 4 months
Reviews.Author: AL1970
Reviews.Content: bought TV 4 months ago, bluetooth will not work after 3 weeks. cutomer service send another remote control - which did not fix problem. repair company send to fix problem - couldn't fix it...Samsung customer service is the worse to deal with!

Reviews.Title: Could be a GREAT TV, but....
Reviews.Author: Mother of A & B
Reviews.Content: Implementation of the network file access limits the user to 4GB files, much smaller than one episode of a normal TV drama recorded in HD. Except for this one GLARING mistake, we think that it is a great concept for a TV.Update: 11/22/2011: A new firmware update has left the streaming from our media server really choppy. So, much so that we had to go back to using our old Media Player and we no longer use the in-built one on this Smart TV. I have updated this review with a comment and am copying some excerpts from the comment here, so that people can understand the situation:"Out setup is a Mythbox that records TV as well as movies and then we view it later on our Smart TV."So the whole scene is as such:"We have a media server that serves TV recordings and movies over our wired network and we used to have a Western Digital Media Player that would feed those to our old TV. With this new SmartTV we replaced that, but soon found that it was not able to stream files over 4GB. What's worse is that with a new firmware update, we have choppy streaming now... so the stream starts fine, then gets choppy and ultimately hangs. Its so bad that we had to go back to our Media Player streaming. :("

Reviews.Title: not bad but not stellar for the price paid
Reviews.Author: cv "cv"
Reviews.Content: I owned it for 2.5 months.the 2008 model that I have provide similar image quality at lower price.to set up the image requires science and the worst (independent of samsung) is dependable on equipment used to capture and broadcast the image. Does help me ? no. The internet due to ultra slow processor(I guess) is annoying and disappointing (shame on samsung).The corner lights, oh yeah! Does bother me - no! - less than 1% of viewing time(if that)The other features - internet related - it is the main street now... even the dvd has themOverall- way overpriced - I weighted a lot to return it and buy other brand or last year model or just wait until is $1500.

Reviews.Title: Great TV and awesome service.
Reviews.Author: Sushant
Reviews.Content: Go it in 5 days when the shipping i selected said 5-8  B'days.came in pristine order. The QWERTY remote is to be ordered later.But The TV did not come with the 3D glasses, that's a cone. yet to check the 3D feature of the TV.Samsung must provide a pair with the set.TV sound and picture quality is worth the money. Its light and sets up easily. It took me just a few minutes to get the fun going!I will strongly recommend this product and for the 17K its a sweet deal.Wont get into the technicalities of why i like this product so much.So far so good.Cheers!!!
